key_channel_insights.line_content: OTA fare parity remains relatively strong at 84.2%, with volatility in lower fares and a modest uptick in premiums indicating subtle shifts in channel pricing.
MSE continues to undercut the Thai Airways site on 91.7% of itineraries with negligible price gaps, though exact matches have shrunk to 6.7%.
GDS fare parity declined to 76.3% last week amid rising discounts and premiums, highlighting a widening price dispersion across that channel.

conclusion.line_content: This report provides a high-level summary of the price discrepancies observed across different channels.  It is important to note that the data contains many nuances depending on various factors such as market conditions, booking windows, and the competitive landscape. Understanding these subtleties can be critical in optimizing pricing strategies and ensuring competitive positioning.

As part of our 'PriceEye' solution, we are developing an intuitive dashboard designed to help your airline's analysts drill down into this data. This tool will allow you to uncover and focus on critical actionable insights, enabling your team to make data-driven decisions with confidence.

We are here to support you in leveraging these insights to enhance your revenue management and distribution strategies. Please don't hesitate to connect with our team for more information about how PriceEye can assist you in achieving your business objectives.

ota_highlights.line_content: OTA fare parity holds at 84.2% with a minor 2.6% month-on-month dip in matched fares.
Channel-lower fares dipped 1.1pp week-on-week but climbed 2.9pp month-on-month, indicating short-term volatility.
Instances where OTAs price above the website increased by 0.95pp week-on-week and 0.12pp month-on-month, signaling modest premium growth.

ota_summary_high_level_comparison.line_content: Unpriced itineraries stood at 2.52%, flat week-on-week (+0.02pp) and down 0.40pp month-on-month.
Matched fares accounted for 84.17%, up 0.12pp week-on-week but down 2.57pp month-on-month.
Lower OTA fares were 7.34% of mix, down 1.09pp week-on-week yet up 2.85pp month-on-month.
Higher OTA fares reached 5.96%, rising 0.95pp week-on-week and 0.12pp month-on-month.

ota_summary_by_region.line_content: Short-haul routes held 82.93% parity, up 0.18pp week-on-week but down 2.64pp month-on-month.
Long-haul parity was 91.04%, but fell 2.99pp week-on-week and 2.71pp month-on-month as OTA premiums increased.

ota_summary_by_point_of_origin.line_content: Thailand-origin itineraries had 92.44% fare matching, down 0.35pp week-on-week and 1.12pp month-on-month amid occasional OTA dips.
Non-Thailand origins showed 53.85% parity, up 2.23pp week-on-week but down 5.24pp month-on-month with high volatility.

ota_summary_by_booking_window.line_content: Close-in bookings exhibited 80.00% parity, decreasing 1.31pp week-on-week and 4.93pp month-on-month as lower OTA fares rose.
Far-out itineraries showed 92.05% parity, up 1.51pp week-on-week and 1.92pp month-on-month, with higher OTA fares increasing 1.24pp.

mse_highlights.line_content: MSE fares were lower than the site in 91.7% of itineraries, up from 88.4% week-on-week and 71.7% month-on-month.
Price parity on MSE fell to 6.7%, down 3.9pp week-on-week and 20.1pp month-on-month.
When MSE is lower it averages a 0.08% discount, matching the 0.08% surcharge when it is higher.

mse_summary_high_level_comparison.line_content: Lower fares appeared in 91.7% of itineraries, marking a 3.4pp week-on-week and 20.1pp month-on-month increase.
Exact matches dropped to 6.7%, a 3.9pp decrease week-on-week and a 20.1pp drop month-on-month.
Routes with higher MSE fares remain rare at 0.9%, stable week-on-week with a slight 0.2pp month-on-month rise.
Listings not found on MSE comprised only 0.7%, up 0.2pp week-on-week and down 0.2pp month-on-month.

mse_summary_by_region.line_content: Short-haul routes saw MSE lower fares 91.6% of the time, up 4.3pp week-on-week with a 0.09% average discount.
Long-haul itineraries had lower MSE rates 93.9% of the time, down 0.1pp week-on-week with a 0.06% average discount.

mse_summary_by_point_of_origin.line_content: Thailand-origin routes had undercuts on 91.6% of itineraries, up 5.1pp week-on-week at a 0.08% average discount.
Non-Thailand origins saw MSE lower fares 91.2% of the time, down 2.3pp week-on-week with a 0.11% average discount.

mse_summary_by_booking_window.line_content: Close-in itineraries had MSE lower fares 93.7% of the time, up 4.0pp week-on-week with a 0.10% average discount.
Far-out itineraries recorded lower MSE prices 88.0%, up 2.8pp week-on-week at a 0.06% average discount.

gds_highlights.line_content: GDS parity declined to 76.32%, down 3.40pp week-on-week and 11.99pp month-on-month.
GDS offered lower fares on 13.79% of itineraries, up 1.49pp week-on-week and 7.50pp month-on-month with a 0.20% average discount.
GDS fares above the website grew to 9.89%, climbing 1.91pp week-on-week and 5.17pp month-on-month with a 0.16% average premium.

gds_summary_high_level_comparison.line_content: No itineraries were missing, maintaining full listing coverage despite a 0.67pp month-on-month drop.
Fare parity held at 76.32%, contracting 3.40pp week-on-week and 11.99pp month-on-month.
Discounted GDS fares represented 13.79% of itineraries, up 1.49pp week-on-week and 7.50pp month-on-month.
Premium GDS fares accounted for 9.89% of itineraries, rising 1.91pp week-on-week and 5.17pp month-on-month.

gds_summary_by_region.line_content: Short-haul parity was 74.80% (down 3.91pp), with 15.72% cheaper fares yielding a 0.21% average discount.
Long-haul parity remained 84.85% (down 0.45pp), with 3.03% cheaper fares delivering a 0.09% average saving.

gds_summary_by_point_of_origin.line_content: Thai-origin parity held at 79.13% (down 4.20pp), with 10.72% cheaper fares averaging a 0.26% discount.
Non-Thai origins saw 64.84% parity (down 0.38pp) and 25.27% discounts averaging 0.11% savings.

gds_summary_by_booking_window.line_content: Close-in itineraries recorded 73.24% parity (down 4.42pp) with 16.55% cheaper fares averaging a 0.22% discount.
Far-out bookings had 81.46% parity (down 1.76pp) and 8.61% cheaper fares yielding a 0.15% average discount.
